name: Unity Basics
description: Covers fundamental Unity concepts, GameObjects, and the Unity Editor.

questions.questionText: What is a GameObject in Unity?

options.text: A visual object in the game
The base class for all entities in a Unity scene

questions.explanation: GameObject is the base class for all entities in a Unity scene. Components are added to GameObjects.

questions.questionText: Which components are commonly used in Unity?
questions.explanation: Transform, Rigidbody, and MeshFilter are valid components. 'Inspector' is not a component — it’s part of the Unity Editor UI.

questions.questionText: Which method is called once when a script is first run?
questions.explanation: Start() is called before the first frame update, only if the script instance is enabled. Awake() is called when the script is loaded.

questions.questionText: Which of the following are valid Unity lifecycle methods?
questions.explanation: Unity has OnEnable, OnDestroy, and FixedUpdate. OnStart() is not a valid Unity method.
